Class SimulationWindow

java.lang.Object
  fr.n7.saceca.u3du.view.SimulationWindow

public class SimulationWindow
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents the 2D swing view of the application.

Author:
Sylvain Cambon & Jérome Dalbert & Anthony Foulfoin & Johann Legaye & Aurélien Chabot

initObjectsTree

public void initObjectsTree()

setSelection

public void setSelection(long id,
                         boolean focusJMEOnSelection)
This method is the only way for an external class to show tabs informations on a given object. This method has to be called from both 2D and 3D controllers if a new object is selected. If the given object is not selected in the swing agent or object list, this method select it. The selection of the object in the agent list or the object tree does not produce events. The tabs corresponding to the given object are automatically displayed. If the method has to ask JME to put the focus on the selected object, the boolean has to be true.

Parameters:
id - The object id
focusJMEOnSelection - True if JME must focus on the selected object

removeObject

public void removeObject(long id)
Remove the specified object from the swing interface. Must be called before the AI destruction

Parameters:
id - the object id

setEditionWindow

public void setEditionWindow(EditionWindow editionWindow)
Sets the edition window.

Parameters:
editionWindow - the new edition window
